page.title: 12BOXHEDGE & LUSHILL FARMS
page.content: Mr.Shepherd,who owns Boxhedge Farm,has fifty three cows,six calves,one horse,three dogs,cats and some hens.A blacksmith visits the farm to shoe the horse.The farmer uses two old tractors and one very modern one,a harvester and a baler.The farmer has seven pasture fields but no arable fields.The farmer finishes work at 6.30pm.The vet comes from Wootton Bassett when needed. Lushill Farm,like Manor Farm,is owned by Captain Barker,who bought it in 1964.At Lushill he has 170 cows,2000 lambs and 1050 sheep.Five people work at the farm,which has changed very much over the past few years.There used to be 90 acres of pasture.Now there are 760 acres.They have planted 1000 young deciduous trees.Fifteen hundred gallons of water are used each day on the farm.
